In ordinary sense, everyone, even the most ordinary person believes in Karma or action. Everyone instinctively believes that he can get a result or fulfil his desire and requirements only if he works. No-one, no God, will do that for him. This is the Law of Karma, As we sow, so we reap. But everything does not depend on our own action, there are many external and unknown factors which determine the result of our action because everything is not under our control. For example, I study very hard to come out first in the class but someone else comes first through competition. An unintelligent student may even fail despite working hard. The result of our action may be equal to our expectations, more or less or even opposite to our expectations. This is because of many unknown factors beyond our self-control. Praying to a God for results only means to hope that the unknown factors will be taken care of. So, the complete law of Karma must include all known and unknown factors. This is mere fact of life and not just a question of faith. We have no alternative but to believe in this. Belief in the Law of Karma empowers us by saying that I am responsible for myself, which is the key to success in life. No one else is responsible for my fate including God. Law of Karma should not make us fatalistic, then its purpose is lost. Law of Karma is also not deterministic because we always have free will to change the destiny of our life by action in the present. In Bhagvadgeeta it is said that knowledge of Self can burn up all Karma of the past in a moment. Now, question is, if there is a theft in my house, am I responsible or the thief is responsible for the theft? I am responsible in the sense that I might not have taken enough precautions to prevent the theft but I have no alternative but to accept the fact of the theft whether I like it or not. The thief is responsible for doing an immoral and illegal act for which he must punished by both human law and devine law. But, whereas my loss is a minor material loss, the loss incurred by the thief is a spiritual loss which is a much greater loss than my loss and for which he has to make a payment as per the Law of Karma in the form of mental suffering.
